intro: Illigera glabra, commonly known as the smooth illigera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, elliptical leaves that are smooth and glabrous. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically arranged in umbels. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
